items.content_html: Disco Elysium is one of a few that I can’t forget, but it’s the only one that I think I’d tattoo quote from. Journey, Life Is Strange and The Witcher are brilliant and one of the greatest experiences I had, but Disco Elysium was something that broke me a little. Highly recommended.
items.content_text: Disco Elysium is one of a few that I can't forget, but it's the only one that I think I'd tattoo quote from. Journey, Life Is Strange and The Witcher are brilliant and one of the greatest experiences I had, but Disco Elysium was something that broke me a little. Highly recommended.

I have my fair share of NFT-related knowledge built upon trading them for a second and I’m really happy that world is actually giving up on that. It might have worked, but I’d say - it’s not gonna work.

items.content_html: In last six months my daily job became much harder and more demanding that it was before. And even though I’m a bit more stressed because of that - I find myself doing good job. Nothing is burning, there are no flames, nothing is blowing up… I mean, that’s at least fine?!
items.content_text: In last six months my daily job became much harder and more demanding that it was before. And even though I'm a bit more stressed because of that - I find myself doing good job. Nothing is burning, there are no flames, nothing is blowing up... I mean, that's at least fine?!

üì∫ The Last of Us (2023) - ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ

I would have never played this game, I’m to scarred of playing horrors. But watching it (and being able to fast forward if needed)… damn, that’s a great story and I’m really happy that I’ve got a chance to know it.

items.content_html:
A short story. We once submitted Untitled Goose Game to the Mac App Store. It was rejected by the reviewer because they thought you couldn‚Äôt skip the credits. (?!?) We explained that you could skip the credits by holding space. It was then rejected for something else and at that point we just gave up and never bothered to resubmit. Fin

– Cabel Sasser

Wow.
items.content_text:
> A short story. We once submitted Untitled Goose Game to the Mac App Store. It was rejected by the reviewer because they thought you couldn‚Äôt skip the credits. (?!?) We explained that you could skip the credits by holding space. It was then rejected for something else and at that point we just gave up and never bothered to resubmit. Fin

-- [Cabel Sasser](https://social.panic.com/@cabel/109977366338856750)

Wow.

items.content_html: Just planned out how and when I’m gonna move our Discourse instance and Mastodon instance. Both are gonna have same spec’d servers, Discourse is getting a bit worse, but Mastodon is getting better one. I think it’s gonna take me lots of hours, but it’s going to be worth it in the end.
items.content_text: Just planned out how and when I'm gonna move our Discourse instance and Mastodon instance. Both are gonna have same spec'd servers, Discourse is getting a bit worse, but Mastodon is getting better one. I think it's gonna take me lots of hours, but it's going to be worth it in the end.

items.content_html:
I’m reading Merlin Mann’s Wisdom document everyday finding what works for me and I have found this gem that is very much true:

Never argue on the internet. No one will remember whether you won or lost the argument; they’ll just remember that you are the sort of person who argues on the internet.
items.content_text:
I'm reading [Merlin Mann's Wisdom](https://github.com/merlinmann/wisdom/blob/master/wisdom.md) document everyday finding what works for me and I have found this gem that is very much true:

>Never argue on the internet. No one will remember whether you won or lost the argument; they'll just remember that you are the sort of person who argues on the internet.

items.content_html: Mastodon is just better than Twitter. It took two months since my birdsite departure to get to this point.

items.content_html: Notes from selfhosting Mastodon instance: with 50 users, a couple of relays, it’s taking more than 50 gigs of space on Backblaze already. Glad that hosting is pennies but if you’re wondering how much space Mastodon could eat - yeah, a lot.
items.content_text: Notes from selfhosting Mastodon instance: with 50 users, a couple of relays, it's taking more than 50 gigs of space on Backblaze already. Glad that hosting is pennies but if you're wondering how much space Mastodon could eat - yeah, a lot.

items.content_html: Dbrand Grip Case. If you could have only one case per phone, this is the one I’m recommending and getting myself. Grippy, feels safe and looks pretty fine if you ask me. That thing on the back, the pixel grid, is a sticker so you can have a different one or none at all.
items.content_text: Dbrand Grip Case. If you could have only one case per phone, this is the one I'm recommending and getting myself. Grippy, feels safe and looks pretty fine if you ask me. That thing on the back, the pixel grid, is a sticker so you can have a different one or none at all.

items.content_html: I’m also very fine with using micro.blog apps to post to Mastodon. The only issue is that I’d like to be able to use Ivory on my mac and it’s going to suck when I can’t (I mean, I can, but then it goes just to my Mastodon) post stuff from it.

items.content_html: Fortunately this will be a quick fix - downloading files from S3 to put them onto the server. Not much of a job, mostly watching upload going from 0 to 100% in couple of minutes.
items.content_text: Fortunately this will be a quick fix - downloading files from S3 to put them onto the server. Not much of a job, mostly watching upload going from 0 to 100% in couple of minutes.

items.content_html: Ok, apparently not everything went as smooth as I’d like it to, but having backups before doing any changes is once again something that saves my ass. Seems to me like Discourse didn’t change links to uploaded data, so when I got rid off /uploads, they are 404ing. Understandable.
items.content_text: Ok, apparently not everything went as smooth as I'd like it to, but having backups before doing any changes is once again something that saves my ass. Seems to me like Discourse didn't change links to uploaded data, so when I got rid off /uploads, they are 404ing. Understandable.

Starting February 9, we will no longer support free access to the Twitter API, both v2 and v1.1. A paid basic tier will be available instead. ‚Äî Twitter Dev

Twitter is effectively killing every free tool built for it, including autoposters, autoblockers and deleters.
items.content_text:
> Starting February 9, we will no longer support free access to the Twitter API, both v2 and v1.1. A paid basic tier will be available instead. ‚Äî [Twitter Dev](https://twitter.com/TwitterDev/status/1621026986784337922)

Twitter is effectively killing every free tool built for it, including autoposters, autoblockers and deleters.
